title: Italy’s President Expected to Ask Mario Draghi to Form New Government
sub_head: Former ECB chief summoned for a meeting with President Sergio Mattarella
body:
ROME—Italy’s president has summoned former European Central Bank President Mario Draghi for a meeting on Wednesday at noon where he is expected to ask him to form a new government.
The decision follows days of political consultations to assess whether a new government could be formed after the center-left one led by Giuseppe Conte collapsed because a small party withdrew its support.
President Sergio Mattarella said Tuesday night that Italy needs a high-profile government to confront the challenges posed by the pandemic on an economic, health and social level.
Mr. Mattarella said that holding early elections this spring would leave the country without a fully empowered government for a number of months at a time in which quick and important decisions need to be taken to confront the pandemic.
“I appeal to all political forces in Parliament to support a high-profile government,” said President Mattarella.
